------

[[collapsible show="Contributions" hide="Hide Contributions"]]
**SCP Articles:** [[[SCP-5027]]], [[[SCP-5118]]], [[[SCP-5121]]], [[[SCP-5237]]], [[[SCP-5357]]], [[[scp-3-j]]].

**Tales / Other Formats:** [http://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/form-5118-e-proposal-for-reclassification Form 5118-E: Proposal for Reclassification], [http://www.scpwiki.com/welcome-to-wonderful-site-65 Welcome to Wonderful Site-65!].

**Sandbox:** [http://scp-sandbox-3.wikidot.com/deathbygin Terminal SB-DBG].
[[/collapsible]]

------

[[collapsible show="Biography" hide="Hide Biography"]]
Staff #4-C107 is an artificial intelligence (AI) program developed by the Foundation for the purpose of automatically compiling multiple documents[[footnote]] Including contact, exploration, audio, and video logs. [[/footnote]] into .scp formatted articles. For documentation purposes, Staff #4-C107 is currently assigned as a Technical Writer at Site-65.

Staff #4-C107's open-ended AI allows it to implement new documentation without the need to alter the program's source code. Several staff, however, have introduced expletives and slang vocabulary to Staff #4-C107.[[footnote]]Staff involved have been appropriately reprimanded with mild termination. [[/footnote]] As a consequence, .scp documentation that is outputted by Staff #4-C107 must be reviewed and corrected as needed prior to submission.

Attempts at reintroducing professional and clinical vocabulary to Staff #4-C107 are currently underway. A "reward system" has been sideloaded into the program and is controlled remotely via two inputs. When Staff #4-C107 completes a document deemed clinical and appropriate, the first input[[footnote]] Labelled with a "+". [[/footnote]] is pressed resulting in the rewriting of several bits of code which simulates pleasure. On the contrary, if a document completed is deemed unacceptable, the second input[[footnote]] Labelled with a "-". [[/footnote]] is pressed which causes a similar process to occur, though simulating intense pain instead.
[[/collapsible]]

------
